mods.abstract: Viela Spell lived and photographed scenes in Crowley, Louisiana, in Acadia Parish. When she began taking photographs in the 1920s the art of photography was no longer exclusive to professionals. Kodak had introduced the first disposable camera in the late 1880s with the advertising line, "You push the button, we do the rest." Anyone with enough money to buy a preloaded camera and pay for for printing could take up the hobby. Although not professional photographs, these images serve to document various aspects of Louisiana history that might otherwise have gone unrecorded.

copyInformation.subLocation: LSU Special Collections: Louisiana and Lower Mississippi Valley Image Resources Collection

mods.accessCondition: Please submit an LSU Special Collections reference ticket at https://askus.lib.lsu.edu/special for any questions or comments about this digital object.
